title: Digital Roots and Repeating Decimals
summary_text: All numbers reduce to single digits through digital root operations. Repeating decimals exhibit the same pattern, with fractions like 1/7 cycling through specific sequences. The doubling sequence 1, 2, 4, 8, 16, 32 reduces to 1, 2, 4, 8, 7, 5 and repeats. This reduction demonstrates symmetry in number systems. The vortex emerges from visualizing these modular relationships.
